intro: Agrostophyllum dewildeorum, commonly known as the Dewilde's grass-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
